intro: The Covid Act Now API provides access to comprehensive COVID data — both current and historical. The data is available for all US states, counties, and metros and is aggregated from a number of official sources, quality assured, and updated daily. It is available in JSON and CSV formats.

productsList.productDescription: Our API is used by organizations and individuals around the country including:

### Where do you source your data from?

Our data comes from official sources including the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, The New York Times, and official state and county dashboards.

### Where can I see all data fields included in your API?

All fields can be found in our [data definitions](https://apidocs.covidactnow.org/data-definitions).  To see an overview of how to query data for states, counties, or metros visit our [getting started guide](https://apidocs.covidactnow.org/access#getting-started).

### When does your data update and at what time?

Our data is updated daily around noon Eastern Time.  Updates reflect the latest available data from each of our sources.

Note that our data is licensed under [Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/). All commercial entities wishing to access our API should contact [info@covidactnow.org](mailto:info@covidactnow.org) to acquire a commercial license. 

We define commercial users as any individual or entity engaged in commercial activities, such as selling goods or services. Our non-commercial users can freely download, use, share, modify, or build upon our source code.

metadataDescription: Latest Covid-19 data and metrics. Our API powers dashboards, websites, and apps. Data tracks all US states, counties, and metros.
